thread.title: Roundup: Billerica earns piece of Merrimack Valley title
thread.title_full: Roundup: Billerica earns piece of Merrimack Valley title | Boston Herald

author: Bob Albright
title: Roundup: Billerica earns piece of Merrimack Valley title
text:
A week after beating North Andover on the road, undefeated Billerica traveled to Haverhill (3-3) and came away with a 42-7 win last night to earn at least a share of the Merrimack Valley Conference Small title.
Senior captain Drew Laundry rushed for 119 yards and three scores to lead the way for Billerica (6-0), which was up 28-7 at the half.
“It feels great to clinch at least a part of the title, but we want to get the title outright next week against Dracut,” Indians coach Duane Sigsbury said.
If they ace that goal, it would be the club’s first title since 1999.
Indians wide receiver Dean Brooks hauled in five balls for 122 yards and a touchdown in the convincing win. Quarterback Justin Beck passed for 248 yard and two touchdowns for Billerica.
Elsewhere last night:
Jack Masterson threw three touchdown passes as No. 3 Marshfield (6-0) rolled over Nauset , 36-8, in the Atlantic Coast League.
Edmund Kelsey rushed for 166 yards and four touchdowns on 16 carries to lead Brockton (4-2) to a 48-27 victory over Durfee in the Big Three.
Coby Tippett returned a punt 64 yards for a score, caught a 17-yard TD pass and also picked off two passes as No. 1 Xaverian (6-0) defeated Malden Catholic , 42-13, in the Catholic Conference.
Steve D’Emilia completed 9-of-12 passes for 180 yards and two touchdowns, both to Matt Reagan, as Bridgewater-Raynham (3-3) beat Barnstable , 48-24, to clinch the Old Colony League title.
Jared Sklar rushed 25 times for 205 yards and three touchdowns as Needham (4-2) knocked off Framingham , 33-14, in the Bay State Carey. . . . John Grady threw a pair of TD passes and David Guekguezian kicked a field goal as Newton North (4-2) edged Weymouth , 17-14.
Lovey Salvant exploded for 300 rushing yards and four touchdowns on 15 carries as Walpole (4-2) cruised past Natick , 42-7, in the Bay State Herget.
Liam Henning completed all 10 passes he attempted for 181 yards and a score as Wayland (4-2) defeated Boston Latin , 34-0, in the Dual County Small, for coach Scott Parseghian’s 100th career win.
Jack Sweeney rushed for two touchdowns as Acton-Boxboro (2-4) defeated Cambridge , 30-20, in the Dual County Large.
Connor Finnerty and Nick Graham both rushed for touchdowns in the fourth quarter as Mansfield (4-2) pulled away from Franklin , 24-3, in the Hockomock Kelley-Rex. . . . Nick Morrison rushed for three touchdowns and also added a fumble recovery for a score as No. 4 North Attleboro (6-0) defeated Taunton , 44-20.
Canton (5-1) had five different players score touchdowns in a 40-14 victory over Oliver Ames in the Hockomock Davenport.
Kendrick Denose ran for 262 yards and four TDs on 31 carries as Methuen (3-3) held off North Andover , 35-34, in the Merrimack Valley Small. . . . Darryl Munoz broke free for a 64-yard rushing score, as well as a 57-yard TD reception as Lawrence (3-3) defeated Dracut , 41-20.
Brett Morris completed 9-of-12 passes for 122 yards and two scores, while Troy Carey racked up 112 rushing yards and two touchdowns, leading Tewksbury (5-1) to a 29-7 win over Chelmsford in a MVC Large game.
Josh Cayer’s 20-yard field goal with 3:56 remaining lifted Bishop Feehan (3-3) to a 9-6 upset of Somerset-Berkley (3-2) in the Eastern Athletic Conference. . . . Nick Landry rushed for 228 yards and two TDs on 22 carries as Bishop Stang (5-1) topped Coyle & Cassidy , 21-6.
Corey DiLoreto threw three touchdowns in the first half as No. 8 Reading (5-1) coasted to a 42-0 win over Woburn in the Middlesex Liberty.
Julian Nyland threw for one score and ran for another as No. 13 Melrose (6-0) clinched the Middlesex Freedom title with a 17-7 win over Stoneham . Samuel Jennings rushed for two touchdowns as Wilmington (3-3) topped Watertown , 20-6. . . . George Balian caught three passes for 61 yards and two scores, while Shane O’Halloran ran for 100 yards and a score as Burlington (4-2) defeated Wakefield , 28-0.
Drew McCarthy rushed for three touchdowns as Lynnfield (5-1) clinched the Cape Ann Baker title with a 42-7 win over Georgetown .
Alex Morris ran and threw for a touchdown as Ipswich (3-3) defeated Manchester-Essex , 18-13, in the Cape Ann Kinney. . . . Hunter Ascolillo caught a 25-yard TD pass from CJ Cooper (18-for-27, 231 yards, two TDs) with 25 seconds left to push Hamilton-Wenham (2-4) past Amesbury , 21-16.
Chris Zuffante threw three TD passes as Winthrop (2-4) defeated Saugus , 40-12, in Northeastern South action. . . . Oscar Lopez scored three times — one rushing, one receiving and a pick-six — as Revere (5-1) cruised to a 46-7 win over Swampscott .
Jack Barrett threw for two scores and ran for a third as Holliston (6-0) clinched the Tri-Valley Large crown with a 34-0 win over Medway . . . . Brendan Patterson threw for three touchdowns as Westwood (4-2) defeated Medfield , 44-7.
Eric Levine threw for four scores as Dover-Sherborn (5-1) defeated Norton , 26-14, in the Tri-Valley Small.
Brandon Cooney provided the offensive spark for Apponequet (3-3), rushing for two touchdowns in a 14-13 win over Seekonk in the South Coast Conference Large.
Andre Smith finished with 85 yards and a touchdown on 10 carries as West Roxbury (2-4) defeated Burke , 12-6, in a Boston City League crossover contest. . . . Terrance Moore rushed for two TDs to lead East Boston (5-1) to a 36-6 win over New Mission . . . . Anthony Cannady and Stephon Anderson combined for 239 rushing yards and four TDs on 23 carries, lifting Madison Park (6-0) to a 26-14 win over rival O’Bryant .
John Beatty rushed for 266 rushing yards and five TDs on 24 carries as Groton (2-0) defeated Middlesex , 35-27, in an Independent School League Small contest.
Ben Clark rushed for three touchdowns as Martha’s Vineyard (3-3) earned a 49-6 win over Brighton in nonleague play. . . . Jared Vargus rushed for 157 yards and three TDs on 13 carries as East Bridgewater (6-0) remained perfect with a 37-14 win over Dighton-Rehoboth .
James LoChirco rushed for 110 yards and a touchdown and Mystic Valley (4-2) stopped a two-point conversion with 55 seconds left to preserve a 24-22 win over Greater Lawrence .
Kat Hasenauer Cornetta, David Pollard, Brendan Connelly, Kevin Barrucci and Robyn Hayes contributed to this report.
